p: All the EO samples presented qualitative and quantitative variations depending on the season of collection. In the dry period, ( E)-caryophyllene (15.71%), caryophyllene oxide (10.25%), 14-hydroxy-9- epi-( E)-caryophyllene (7.02%), α-cadinol (5%), allohimachalol (3.49%), caryophylla-4(12), 8(13)-dien-5-α-ol (3.31%), and α-copaene (3.25%) were obtained as the main components. In the rainy period, hexanal (26.1%), ( E)-caryophyllene (20.3%), caryophyllene oxide (16.3%), (2 E)-hexenal (6.63%), α-copaene (4.84%), 14-hydroxy-9- epi-( E)-caryophyllene (4.63%), and nonanal (3.24%) were obtained as the major constituents. Therefore, EOs of the same species may vary qualitatively and quantitatively in composition, depending on the location, time of the day, climate, and season of the year [ 24, 25, 26].
